image.name: B000149_001

profileText: a Representative from California; born in Cleveland, Ohio, March 17, 1858; attended the common schools; moved to Ventura, Calif., in 1875 and to San Luis Obispo County, Calif., 1889; farmer; businessman; member of the California state assembly, 1892-1893; chairman of the People's Party state convention, 1896; elected as a Populist to the Fifty-fifth Congress (March 4, 1897-March 3, 1899); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Fifty-sixth Congress in 1898; unsuccessful candidate for election to the Sixtieth Congress in 1906; delegate to the Democratic National Conventions, 1912 and 1920; died on October 3, 1927, in Bakersfield, Calif.; interment in Union Cemetery, Bakersfield, Calif.

asset.name: B000149_001

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Barlow, Charles Averill. Speech of Hon. C. A. Barlow, of California, in the House of Representatives. Washington: [Government Printing Office], 1898.
